name: Comfort Inn Airport/International Center

reviews.text: We stayed here in March 2006 based on the decent reviews and good price from Expedia. We got there for the happy hour, which was decent. We were also pleased with the included breakfast.
reviews.title: Some good points, some bad points
The Best Value in Salt Lake City
reviews.text: We were disappointed with the room however. One of the beds 'wobbled', making it hard to sleep on. The rooms are fairly noisy. Not really from the air traffic, but from the highway noise. Also, it was very easy to hear other room noises. I tried to turn on the heater/air conditioner to run a fan to block the noises, but it didn't work.

On our check-in, something got messed up and during our first night somebody tried to enter our room because they gave our room to somebody else since they thought the room was available. That got resolved, but it just added to our frustration.
reviews.title: Spot on - perfect

reviews.text: Although the price was great and it had some nice benefits (happy hour, breakfast) we'll likely try somewhere else next time.
reviews.title: Only so-so

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Airport Comfort Inn. We arrived in time for the complimentary manager’s reception – a nice surprise with their hearty appetizers and drinks. We had a great dinner at the Cedar Creek Grill and our room was perfect. There even was free high speed internet for my laptop and a microwave/refrigerator. The surprise for us was that we could choose a VHS movie from a library of movies for free. We will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Clean, Comfortable

reviews.text: Great place to stay and you can get a good rate by checking orbitz or one of the other travel sites and then going to the hotel site and taking advantage of their lowest price guarantee - they'll give you 10% off the lowest price you can find on the internet. Worked for us - got a $52 rate. Only there for one night but the free complete breakfast was great and the room was very nice.
reviews.title: Highly recommend

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel twice in May when I traveled around Utah. The first time was when I arrived and then the night before I departed. The rooms were excellent - clean, nice size & everything you could need. They offer breakfast which they call "continental," but it's more than that. They offer, eggs, potatoes and breads. Obviously less than a traditional buffet, but a heck of a lot more than the traditional continental breakfast of donuts and danishes.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!
Terrific Value
reviews.text: Great location too if you need to get to/from the airport. Great value for your money and I highly recommend it.

aka: Comfort Inn Airport/International Hotel Salt Lake City
